data.content:
The #SouthernLights are the same charged particles colliding with gases in Earths upper atmosphere to produce dancing light in the southern hemisphere! Here they are glimmering over the Indian Ocean.

: NASA https://t.co/rQkvOPoWt0

Winter weather is coming to a place near you! These satellite images show recent snow covers over parts of Quebec and Saskatchewan. Time to dig out those woollies and bundle up! 

Credits: Sentinel-2 / NASAS VIIRS satellite https://t.co/cmqkVTWaOg

data.content:
What kind of astronomical object is this? 

It doesnt look quite like the kinds of galaxies, nebulae, star clusters, or galaxy clusters that Hubble normally brings us images of...

In fact, this is a spiral galaxy, named UGC 10043  we just happen to see it directly from the https://t.co/aX76tX36JD
